title: AG Campbell skeptical of proposed law to ban ICE agents from wearing masks
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Attorney General Andrea Campbell doubts state legislation can prevent ICE agents from wearing masks in Massachusetts.
Campbell urged pursuing federal legislation, citing limits on state power over federal agents' identification policies.
State Rep. Jim Hawkins filed a bill targeting masked federal agents; Senate President Karen Spilka supports it.

title: Birds of Paradise, Brighton’s travel-themed cocktail bar, closes at the Speedway
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Birds of Paradise, a travel-themed cocktail bar in Brighton, closed on October 31 after two years of operation.
The bar, known for its globally inspired cocktails, was opened by Ran Duan in 2022 at Charles River Speedway.
An ongoing investigation involving Duan, related to a death at his home, was reported without charges being filed.

title: Child struck by school bus, driver arrested in Medway
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A child riding a bike was struck by a school bus near Francis J. Burke Memorial Elementary School in Medway.
Bus driver Kenneth Benjamin, 69, was arrested for disorderly conduct after the incident, not for the crash itself.
Benjamin was cited for failing to stop for a person in a crosswalk and arraigned in Wrentham District Court.

title: TD Bank plans to shutter 6 Mass. branches amid nationwide closures
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: TD Bank will close six branches and one remote drive-thru in Massachusetts as part of a national plan to close 51 locations.
The closures are part of TD Bank's strategy to enhance its U.S. retail presence with tech-forward banking and new store openings.
TD Bank's recent $1.8 billion federal settlement is unrelated to these closures, as the bank focuses on compliance and recovery.

title: Longtime 7News anchor Kim Khazei is signing off
author: John Waller
bullets: Kim Khazei, a 7News anchor since 1994, will sign off at the end of the year.
Khazei has covered major stories like Patriots' Super Bowl wins and royal weddings during her tenure.
She is relocating to be closer to her first grandchild, after over two decades with 7News.

title: Payton Pritchard addresses his shooting woes as Celtics struggle as a whole
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Celtics start season with 3-5 record, struggling in three-point accuracy despite high attempt rate.
Payton Pritchard confident despite personal shooting slump, views current struggles as temporary.
Coach Joe Mazzulla attributes shooting woes to new play-style, defensive adjustments impacting players.

title: How Mass. native Georges Niang reacted to Celtics’ decision to trade him
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Georges Niang was briefly with the Celtics after a trade involving Kristaps Porzingis but was soon traded to Utah.
The Methuen native appreciates the Celtics' transparency despite the brief stint and understands the business side of the NBA.
Niang, recovering from a foot injury, did not play in Utah's 105-103 win over the Celtics in Boston.

title: Two Mass. men arrested in Harvard Medical School explosion
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Logan David Patterson, 18, of Plymouth, and Dominick Frank Cardoza, 20, of Bourne, arrested for Harvard explosion.
Explosion involved a large commercial firework; damage was limited and no injuries reported, authorities state.
Suspects identified through CCTV and public tips; court appearances scheduled; charges include conspiracy to cause damage.

title: ‘This has nothing to do with us,’ BPD commissioner says amid Karen Read attorney’s calls for disciplinary review
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Boston Police Commissioner Michael Cox denies involvement in Karen Read's case amid attorney's disciplinary review request.
Attorney Alan Jackson accused Cox of lying about connections to Read's trial, suggesting inclusion on prosecutors' Brady list.
Cox reaffirmed no departmental link to Read's charges, offering condolences to the late officer John O’Keefe's family.

title: Missing Worcester woman found dead in car
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Joanna Brown, 30, was found dead in her car on Mount Vernon St., Worcester, on Monday afternoon.
Brown was reported missing on Sunday after last being seen at the Bean Counter Bakery Cafe on Friday.
Worcester Police and the District Attorney's Office are investigating her death; cause of death is yet undetermined.
